channel.title: A guide to better web browsing
channel.description: First off, you'll need the latest Mozilla Firefox. If you don't have it, get it from http://firefox.com Next, you want to get rid off ads. Ads are a nuisance. [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/1865/]Adblock Plus[/url] After that, you'll want to get a good list. I use [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/1136/]Filterset.G[/url] Lastly, we'll get NoScript. NoScript is an extension that blocks scripts from web pages. This is very handy as most browser exploits are done through scripting. [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/722/]NoScript[/url] If a site you use requires scripting, it is easy to allow. Here is an example: [img]http://xs313.xs.to/xs313/07114/allow.PNG[/img] That is all for now.

item.title: A guide to better web browsing
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

nice, didnt know about the script thing.

Read full topic

item.title: A guide to better web browsing
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

First off, you’ll need the latest Mozilla Firefox. If you don’t have it, get it from http://firefox.com
Next, you want to get rid off ads. Ads are a nuisance.
Adblock Plus
After that, you’ll want to get a good list. I use Filterset.G
Lastly, we’ll get NoScript. NoScript is an extension that blocks scripts from web pages. This is very handy as most browser exploits are done through scripting.
NoScript
If a site you use requires scripting, it is easy to allow.
Here is an example:
That is all for now.
